title: G major compose bass line - 2-2-1 final cadence

content.question: Complete the bass line for the melody below, following eighteenth-century voice-leading procedures. Below the bass line, write the Roman and Arabic numerals that indicate the harmonies and inversions implied by the soprano and bass. Observe the following: Keep the portion you compose consistent with the first phrase. Write an appropriate cadence at each phrase ending. Give melodic interest to the bass line. (Nonharmonic tones, if included, should be limited to unaccented passing and neighbor tones.) Vary the motion of the bass line in relation to the soprano. Use mostly quarter notes. (Where appropriate, note values ranging from half notes to eighth notes may be used.) Do not notate alto and tenor lines. Enter any notes as you prepare your response.
